message: If so, what are you into? :)
i guess mastodon though i was displeased with cracke the skye
i realy liked burst, and then they broke up, lazarus bird was such a great album.
so yeah, I guess i'm a metalhead
:P
shit forgot.... nevermore I go through phases where I'll listen to them constantly

i guess i am. I've been infatuated with old school thrash bands putting out solid albums as of late. Exodus, Overkill, Testament, Kreator have all put out great stuff in the last decade, more so than those "big 4" bands.
also, gotten in to opeth, baroness, triptykon, high on fire, bison bc.....
Hah yeah I'd say you are a metalhead :P that's cool. I like a bunch of different stuff: http://www.last.fm/user/kvanderwyk
never could get into mastodon though =\
hell yea, METAL \m/

and @tbatterii you're first person I've heard of that likes mastodon but didn't like cracke the skye.  I honestly thought it was a masterpiece and nothing else in their library seems to quite stack up to it.  What is your fave album by them?
for me... mostly the big 4 + pantera + opeth + mastodon
I used to be a metalhead, then I bought two decks and loads of techno
sometimes I still listen to Neurosis, which is great

@kevinflo eh to me it's kind of like their black album. it's good, but it's going in a more "poppy" direction that could turn out badly. :) I probably listen to leviathan the most, now that I think about it, blood mountain had some indications that Cracke the Skye was coming. I just hope they can still do the hard stuff along with the melodic stuff.
I grew up with the death metal scene in Orlando, Florida during the eighties. Living in Germany now and surrounded by metal! Still love eighties style death metal and some thrash from then also!
@tbatterii thanks for the Pig Destroyer. Found it on @rdio. Good cycling music.
this week I can't get enough of Pig Destroyer. they remind of a band from Cincinnati called noarmsnolegs http://bit.ly/hUhnlS
@BrianRNelson anytime
MEGADETH!!!!! Ftw xD
I HAZ A ALUMINUM TIN FOIL HAT FROM MY CRAZED GRANPAPPY.
